ontology_metadata.label: centigray
ontology_metadata.definition: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to 0.01 gray (Gy)

ontology_metadata.label: gray
ontology_metadata.definition: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to the absorption of one joule of radiation energy by one kilogram of matter.

ontology_metadata.label: milligray
ontology_metadata.definition: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gray or 10^[-3] Gy.

ontology_metadata.label: microgray
ontology_metadata.definition: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one millionth of a gray or 10^[-6] Gy.

ontology_metadata.label: milligray
ontology_metadata.definition: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gray or 10^[-3] Gy.

ontology_metadata.label: nanogray
ontology_metadata.definition: An absorbed dose unit which is equal to one thousandth of a millionth of a gray or 10^[-9] Gy.

ontology_metadata.label: meter per second per second
ontology_metadata.definition: An acceleration unit which is equal to the acceleration an object changing its velocity by 1meter/s over a time period that equals one second.

ontology_metadata.label: meter per second per second
ontology_metadata.definition: An acceleration unit which is equal to the acceleration an object changing its velocity by 1meter/s over a time period that equals one second.

ontology_metadata.label: mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A substance unit which is equal to the amount of substance of a molecular system which contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 0.012 kilogram of carbon 12.

ontology_metadata.label: mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A substance unit which is equal to the amount of substance of a molecular system which contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 0.012 kilogram of carbon 12.

ontology_metadata.label: degree
ontology_metadata.definition: A plane angle unit which is equal to 1/360 of a full rotation or 1.7453310^[-2] rad.

ontology_metadata.label: radian
ontology_metadata.definition: A plane angle unit which is equal to the angle subtended at the center of a circle by an arc equal in length to the radius of the circle, approximately 57 degrees 17 minutes and 44.6 seconds.

ontology_metadata.label: radian per second per second
ontology_metadata.definition: An angular unit acceleration which is equal to the angular acceleration of an object changing its angular velocity by 1rad/s over a time period that equals one second.

ontology_metadata.label: acre
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equivalent to 1 furlong x 1 chain. This is equal to an area of 4,046.856,4224 square meters, or 43,500 square feet.

ontology_metadata.label: hectare
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equal to an area of 10,000 square meters. Equivalent to 2.471 acres.

ontology_metadata.label: square centimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equal to one ten thousandth of a square meter or 10^[-4] m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: square millimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equal to one millionth of a square meter or 10^[-6] m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: square meter
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equal to an area enclosed by a square with sides each 1 meter long.

ontology_metadata.label: square micrometer
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equal to an area enclosed by a square with sides each 1 micrometer long.

ontology_metadata.label: square millimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: An area unit which is equal to one millionth of a square meter or 10^[-6] m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: katal per cubic meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one cubic meter.

ontology_metadata.label: katal per liter
ontology_metadata.definition: A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one thousandth of a cubic meter.

ontology_metadata.label: katal per cubic meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one cubic meter.

ontology_metadata.label: katal per liter
ontology_metadata.definition: A catalytic (activity) concentration unit which is equal to 1 katal activity of a catalyst in a given volume of one thousandth of a cubic meter.

ontology_metadata.label: millisievert
ontology_metadata.definition: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a sievert or 10^[-3] Sv.

ontology_metadata.label: microsievert
ontology_metadata.definition: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one millionth of a sievert or 10^[-6] Sv.

ontology_metadata.label: millisievert
ontology_metadata.definition: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a sievert or 10^[-3] Sv.

ontology_metadata.label: nanosievert
ontology_metadata.definition: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to one thousandth of a millionth of a sievert or 10^[-9] Sv.

ontology_metadata.label: sievert
ontology_metadata.definition: A dose equivalent unit which is equal to the absorption of one joule of radiation energy by one kilogram of matter.

ontology_metadata.label: ampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit which is equal to the constant current which, if maintained in two straight parallel conductors of infinite length, of negligible circular cross-section, and placed 1 m apart in vacuum, would produce between these conductors a force equal to 2 x 10^[-7] newton per meter of length.

ontology_metadata.label: milliampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit current which is equal to one thousandth of an ampere or 10^[-3] A.

ontology_metadata.label: microampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit current which is equal to one millionth of an ampere or 10^[-6] A.

ontology_metadata.label: milliampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit current which is equal to one thousandth of an ampere or 10^[-3] A.

ontology_metadata.label: milliampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit current which is equal to one thousandth of an ampere or 10^[-3] A.

ontology_metadata.label: picoampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit current which is equal to one trillionth of an ampere or 10^[-12] A.

ontology_metadata.label: picoampere
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric current unit current which is equal to one trillionth of an ampere or 10^[-12] A.

ontology_metadata.label: volt per meter
ontology_metadata.definition: The volt per meter is a unit of electric field strength equal to the a potential difference of 1 volt existing between two points that are 1 meter apart.

ontology_metadata.label: volt per meter
ontology_metadata.definition: The volt per meter is a unit of electric field strength equal to the a potential difference of 1 volt existing between two points that are 1 meter apart.

ontology_metadata.label: kilovolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one thousand volts or 10^[3] V.

ontology_metadata.label: megavolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one million volts or 10^[6] V.

ontology_metadata.label: microvolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one millionth of a volt or 10^[-6] V.

ontology_metadata.label: millivolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one thousandth of a volt or 10^[-3] V.

ontology_metadata.label: nanovolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one billionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V.

ontology_metadata.label: picovolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one trillionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V.

ontology_metadata.label: picovolt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to one trillionth of a volt or 10^[-12] V.

ontology_metadata.label: volt
ontology_metadata.definition: An electric potential difference unit which is equal to the work per unit charge. One volt is the potential difference required to move one coulomb of charge between two points in a circuit while using one joule of energy.

ontology_metadata.label: large calorie
ontology_metadata.definition: A unit of energy widely used in nutrition, equivalent to the amount of heat needed to cause one kilogram of water to rise in temperature by one degree Celsius.

ontology_metadata.label: large calorie
ontology_metadata.definition: A unit of energy widely used in nutrition, equivalent to the amount of heat needed to cause one kilogram of water to rise in temperature by one degree Celsius.

ontology_metadata.label: electronvolt
ontology_metadata.definition: A non-SI unit of energy (eV) defined as the energy acquired by a single unbound electron when it passes through an electrostatic potential difference of one volt. An electronvolt is equal to 1.602 176 53(14) x 10^-19 J.

ontology_metadata.label: gigaelectronvolt
ontology_metadata.definition: A unit of energy that is equal to one thousand million electronvolts.

ontology_metadata.label: joule
ontology_metadata.definition: An energy unit which is equal to the energy required when a force of 1 newton moves an object 1 meter in the direction of the force.

ontology_metadata.label: large calorie
ontology_metadata.definition: A unit of energy widely used in nutrition, equivalent to the amount of heat needed to cause one kilogram of water to rise in temperature by one degree Celsius.

ontology_metadata.label: kilowatt-hour
ontology_metadata.definition: An energy unit which is equal to 1,000 watt-hours.

ontology_metadata.label: electronvolt
ontology_metadata.definition: A non-SI unit of energy (eV) defined as the energy acquired by a single unbound electron when it passes through an electrostatic potential difference of one volt. An electronvolt is equal to 1.602 176 53(14) x 10^-19 J.

ontology_metadata.label: joule
ontology_metadata.definition: An energy unit which is equal to the energy required when a force of 1 newton moves an object 1 meter in the direction of the force.

ontology_metadata.label: watt-hour
ontology_metadata.definition: An energy unit which is equal to the amount of electrical energy equivalent to a one-watt load drawing power for one hour.

ontology_metadata.label: newton
ontology_metadata.definition: A force unit which is equal to the force required to cause an acceleration of 1m/s2 of a mass of 1 Kg in the direction of the force.

ontology_metadata.label: newton
ontology_metadata.definition: A force unit which is equal to the force required to cause an acceleration of 1m/s2 of a mass of 1 Kg in the direction of the force.

ontology_metadata.label: hertz
ontology_metadata.definition: A frequency unit which is equal to 1 complete cycle of a recurring phenomenon in 1 second.

ontology_metadata.label: megaHertz
ontology_metadata.definition: A frequency unit which is equal to one million hertz or 10^[6] V.

ontology_metadata.label: hertz
ontology_metadata.definition: A frequency unit which is equal to 1 complete cycle of a recurring phenomenon in 1 second.

ontology_metadata.label: lux
ontology_metadata.definition: An illuminance unit which is equal to the illuminance produced by 1 lumen evenly spread over an area 1 m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: lux
ontology_metadata.definition: An illuminance unit which is equal to the illuminance produced by 1 lumen evenly spread over an area 1 m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: bit
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which refers to a digit in the binary numeral system, which consists of base 2 digits (ie there are only 2 possible values: 0 or 1).

ontology_metadata.label: byte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 8 bits.

ontology_metadata.label: gigabyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000000000 bytes.

ontology_metadata.label: gigabyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000000000 bytes.

ontology_metadata.label: kibibyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1024 B.

ontology_metadata.label: kibibyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1024 B.

ontology_metadata.label: kilobyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000 bytes.

ontology_metadata.label: kilobyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000 bytes.

ontology_metadata.label: mebibyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1024 KiB.

ontology_metadata.label: mebibyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1024 KiB.

ontology_metadata.label: megabyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000 kB.

ontology_metadata.label: megabyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000 kB.

ontology_metadata.label: terabyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000 gigabytes.

ontology_metadata.label: terabyte
ontology_metadata.definition: An information unit which is equal to 1000 gigabytes.

ontology_metadata.label: centimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one hundredth of a meter or 10^[-2] m.

ontology_metadata.label: chain
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 20.1168 metres, 66 feet, or 22 yards.

ontology_metadata.label: fathom
ontology_metadata.definition: A maritime length unit which is equal to 6.08 feet, or 1.853184 metres

ontology_metadata.label: foot
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 0.3048 metres, or 12 inches.

ontology_metadata.label: inch
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 0.0254 metres.

ontology_metadata.label: kilometer
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one thousand meters.

ontology_metadata.label: millimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of a meter or 10^[-3] m.

ontology_metadata.label: meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to the length of the path traveled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second.

ontology_metadata.label: inch
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 0.0254 metres.

ontology_metadata.label: micrometer
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one millionth of a meter or 10^[-6] m.

ontology_metadata.label: micrometer
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one millionth of a meter or 10^[-6] m.

ontology_metadata.label: thou
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 0.0254 millimetres.

ontology_metadata.label: mile
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 1,609.344 metres, or 8 furlongs.

ontology_metadata.label: millimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of a meter or 10^[-3] m.

ontology_metadata.label: nanometer
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a meter or 10^[-9] m.

ontology_metadata.label: nautical mile
ontology_metadata.definition: A maritime length unit which is equal to 6,080 feet, 10 cables, or 1,853.184 metres

ontology_metadata.label: picometer
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 10^[-12] m.

ontology_metadata.label: picometer
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 10^[-12] m.

ontology_metadata.label: yard
ontology_metadata.definition: A length unit which is equal to 0.9144 metres, or 3 feet.

ontology_metadata.label: kilogram per meter
ontology_metadata.definition: An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in kilograms divided by one meter.

ontology_metadata.label: candela per square meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminance unit which is equal to a luminous intensity of one candela radiating from a surface whose area is one square meter.

ontology_metadata.label: candela per square meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminance unit which is equal to a luminous intensity of one candela radiating from a surface whose area is one square meter.

ontology_metadata.label: candela per square meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminance unit which is equal to a luminous intensity of one candela radiating from a surface whose area is one square meter.

ontology_metadata.label: lumen
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminous flux unit which is equal to the luminous flux emitted into 1 steradian by a point source of 1 candela.

ontology_metadata.label: lumen
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminous flux unit which is equal to the luminous flux emitted into 1 steradian by a point source of 1 candela.

ontology_metadata.label: candela
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminous intensity unit which equal to the luminous intensity, in a given direction, of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency 540 x 1012 hertz and that has a radiant intensity in that direction of 1/683 watt per steradian.

ontology_metadata.label: candela
ontology_metadata.definition: A luminous intensity unit which equal to the luminous intensity, in a given direction, of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency 540 x 1012 hertz and that has a radiant intensity in that direction of 1/683 watt per steradian.

ontology_metadata.label: weber
ontology_metadata.definition: A magnetic flux unit which is equal to the amount of flux that when linked with a single turn of wire for an interval of one second will induce an electromotive force of one volt.

ontology_metadata.label: weber
ontology_metadata.definition: A magnetic flux unit which is equal to the amount of flux that when linked with a single turn of wire for an interval of one second will induce an electromotive force of one volt.

ontology_metadata.label: tesla
ontology_metadata.definition: A magnetic flux density unit which is equal to one weber per square meter.

ontology_metadata.label: tesla
ontology_metadata.definition: A magnetic flux density unit which is equal to one weber per square meter.

ontology_metadata.label: dalton

ontology_metadata.label: milligram per deciliter
ontology_metadata.definition: A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in milligrams divided by the volume in deciliters.

ontology_metadata.label: milligram per milliliter
ontology_metadata.definition: A mass unit density which is equal to mass of an object in milligrams divided by the volume in milliliters.

ontology_metadata.definition: A gram per milliliter unit which is equal to one picogram per one milliliter.

ontology_metadata.label: gram per mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A molar mass unit which is equal to one gram of mass of one mole of chemical element or chemical compound.

ontology_metadata.label: kilogram per mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A molar mass unit which is equal to one kilogram of mass of one mole of chemical element or chemical compound.

ontology_metadata.label: gram per mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A molar mass unit which is equal to one gram of mass of one mole of chemical element or chemical compound.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic centimeter per mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A molar volume unit which is equal to 1 cubic centimeter occupied by one mole of a substance in the form of a solid, liquid, or gas.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic meter per mole
ontology_metadata.definition: A molar volume unit which is equal to 1 cubic meter occupied by one mole of a substance in the form of a solid, liquid, or gas.

ontology_metadata.label: kilogram meter per second
ontology_metadata.definition: A momentum unit which is equal to the momentum of a one kilogram mass object with a speed of one meter per second.

ontology_metadata.label: watt
ontology_metadata.definition: A power unit which is equal to the power used when work is done at the rate of 1 joule per second.

ontology_metadata.label: watt
ontology_metadata.definition: A power unit which is equal to the power used when work is done at the rate of 1 joule per second.

ontology_metadata.label: bar
ontology_metadata.definition: A pressure unit which is equal to 100,000 pascal or the pressure or stress on a surface caused by a force of 100,000 newtons spread over a surface of 1 m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: pascal
ontology_metadata.definition: A pressure unit which is equal to the pressure or stress on a surface caused by a force of 1 newton spread over a surface of 1 m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: pascal
ontology_metadata.definition: A pressure unit which is equal to the pressure or stress on a surface caused by a force of 1 newton spread over a surface of 1 m^[2].

ontology_metadata.label: pounds per square inch
ontology_metadata.definition: A pressure unit which is equal to 6894.757 pascal.

ontology_metadata.label: millicurie
ontology_metadata.definition: An activity (of a radionuclide) unit which is equal to one thousandth of a curie or 10^[-3] Ci.

ontology_metadata.label: parts per billion
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[9].

ontology_metadata.label: parts per hundred
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 100 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same.

ontology_metadata.label: parts per million
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[6].

ontology_metadata.label: parts per quadrillion
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[15].

ontology_metadata.label: parts per thousand
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1000 regardless of the units of measure as long as they are the same.

ontology_metadata.label: parts per trillion
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless concentration notation which denotes the amount of a given substance in a total amount of 1,000,000,000 regardless of the units of measure used as long as they are the same or 1 part in 10^[12].

ontology_metadata.label: percent
ontology_metadata.definition: A dimensionless ratio unit which denotes numbers as fractions of 100.

ontology_metadata.label: steradian
ontology_metadata.definition: A solid angle unit which is equal to the solid angle subtended at the center of a sphere by an area on the surface of the sphere that is equal to the radius squared.

ontology_metadata.label: steradian
ontology_metadata.definition: A solid angle unit which is equal to the solid angle subtended at the center of a sphere by an area on the surface of the sphere that is equal to the radius squared.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic meter per kilogram
ontology_metadata.definition: A specific volume unit which is equal to one cubic meter volume occupied by one kilogram of a particular substance.

ontology_metadata.label: dyne per cm
ontology_metadata.definition: A surface tension unit which is equal to one dyne per centimeter.

ontology_metadata.label: newton per meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A surface tension unit which is equal to one newton per meter.

ontology_metadata.label: newton per meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A surface tension unit which is equal to one newton per meter.

ontology_metadata.label: kelvin
ontology_metadata.definition: A thermodynamic temperature unit which is equal to the fraction 1/273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water.

ontology_metadata.label: kelvin
ontology_metadata.definition: A thermodynamic temperature unit which is equal to the fraction 1/273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water.

ontology_metadata.label: day
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to 24 hours.

ontology_metadata.label: hour
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to 3600 seconds or 60 minutes.

ontology_metadata.label: millisecond
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to one thousandth of a second or 10^[-3] s.

ontology_metadata.label: microsecond
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to one millionth of a second or 10^[-6] s.

ontology_metadata.label: millisecond
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to one thousandth of a second or 10^[-3] s.

ontology_metadata.label: minute
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to 60 seconds.

ontology_metadata.label: nanosecond
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to one thousandth of one millionth of a second or 10^[-9] s.

ontology_metadata.label: picosecond
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to 10^[-12] s.

ontology_metadata.label: picosecond
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to 10^[-12] s.

ontology_metadata.label: second
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to the duration of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom.

ontology_metadata.label: year
ontology_metadata.definition: A time unit which is equal to 12 months which in science is taken to be equal to 365.25 days.

ontology_metadata.label: kilometer per hour
ontology_metadata.definition: A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 kilometer distance in one hour.

ontology_metadata.label: meter per second
ontology_metadata.definition: A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 meter distance in one second.

ontology_metadata.label: meter per second
ontology_metadata.definition: A speed/velocity unit which is equal to the speed of an object traveling 1 meter distance in one second.

ontology_metadata.label: liter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 decimeter.

ontology_metadata.label: liter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 decimeter.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic centimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to one millionth of a cubic meter or 10^[-9] m^[3], or to 1 ml.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic decimeter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to one thousand of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 L.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to the volume of a cube with edges one meter in length. One cubic meter equals to 1000 liters.

ontology_metadata.label: cubic meter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to the volume of a cube with edges one meter in length. One cubic meter equals to 1000 liters.

ontology_metadata.label: liter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 decimeter.

ontology_metadata.label: deciliter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to one tenth of a liter or 10^[-1] L.

ontology_metadata.label: femtoliter
ontology_metadata.definition: A volume unit which is equal to 10^[-15] L.

ontology_metadata.label: fluid ounce
ontology_metadata.definition: An imperial volume unit which is equivalent to 28.413,0625 millilitres.

ontology_metadata.label: gallon
